Class Server

java.lang.Object
tcpsnake.Server
public class Server extends Object
Represents the server for the Snake game played over TCP. It handles player connections, game state updates, and communication with clients.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a new Server instance.

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server(int playerCount, int port, int rounds) throws IOException
      Constructs a new Server instance.
      Parameters:
      playerCount - the number of players who will join the game
      port - the port on which the server will listen
      rounds - the number of rounds to be played
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs when opening the socket

  • Method Details

    • saveHighScore

      public static void saveHighScore(String playerName, int score)
      Saves a player's high score to the `highScores` map and writes it to a file. If the player already has a recorded score, it will be updated with the new value. The file format remains consistent, storing scores in the format: 
       playerName:score
      Parameters:
      playerName - The name of the player whose score is being saved.
      score - The score achieved by the player.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game, including multiple rounds if specified. Manages the main game loop and handles round transitions.

    • processPlayerInput

      public void processPlayerInput(int playerId, String input)
      Processes input from a specific player by adding the command to the player's queue.
      Parameters:
      playerId - the ID of the player
      input - the command received from the player

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method to start the server. Usage: java tcpsnake.Server <player_count> <port> <rounds>
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments specifying the number of players, port, and rounds
